content: the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 4 sts fptr fpdc around the next st make 1tr double_crochet ch1 1tr double_crochet in the next chain-space fptr fpdc around the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 4 sts* repeat from * to * 4 times miss the next st fptr fpdc around the fptr fpdc below miss the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 5 sts in the last st end with 2tr double_crochet turn 4 ch3 this counts as your first treble_crochet double_crochet make 1 treble_crochet double_crochet in the same st make 1tr double_crochet in each of the nexts 5 sts *miss the next st bptr bpdc around the bptr bpdc below miss the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 4 sts bptr bpdc around the next st make 1tr double_crochet ch1 1tr double_crochet in the next chain-space bptr bpdc around the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 4 sts* repeat from * to * 4 times miss the next st bptr bpdc around the bptr bpdc below miss the next st 1tr double_crochet in each of the next 5 sts in the last st end with 2tr double_crochet turn repeat row 3 and 4 over until you reach the end of your whirl i found a gentle blocking opened out the design more my scarf measured 16 inches by 68 inches in length if you want to widen this wrap as i have done so on my hand-dyed version the just do multiples 14sts +1 plus 3 for your foundation chain for this version i m using 4 x 100g skeins of yarn from birdstreet yarns the colour ways i m using are oh romeo shale these are super wash merino yarn and i m using corsican and pen y fan which are both corriedale mohair i love the mixture of the yarns i started with a chain of 116 which gives it a bit of depth i ve alternated my yarns so that i start with a super wash then switch to a mohair i ve done this through out i started by doing 8 row of each colour then 12 of each colour then i ll move onto 16 of each i m sure you can see a pattern emerging play about with textures and colour and see what you think i really hope you enjoy this pattern if you have any questions please pop me a message to suzy@daisyboo net suzy xx this is a simplified chart of the design you just add in the extra repeats
